com.flowpowered.persistence.config.ini

Class IniConfiguration

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.flowpowered.persistence.config.AbstractConfigurationNodeSource
      • com.flowpowered.persistence.config.AbstractConfiguration
        • com.flowpowered.persistence.config.ini.IniConfiguration
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    CommentedConfiguration, Configuration, ConfigurationNodeSource, FileConfiguration
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    StringLoadingIniConfiguration

    public class IniConfiguration
extends AbstractConfiguration
implements CommentedConfiguration, FileConfiguration
    This class handles reading and writing configuration nodes in the INI format. Because the INI format is fairly loose, this class can read INI files written with a few formats. However, when writing INI files the configuration's settings will override what was previously in the file The INI format also has a few limitations over other formats.
    • Limited hierarchy: The format can only have one level of children (sections)
    • Extremely basic datatype support: The configuration can split up lists, but otherwise all values are stored as strings. Maps are not supported.
    • Saving files exactly as they were loaded is in some cases impossible.
    An example INI file is as follows: 
         # All nodes outside of a section are given above the first section specifier
     # The : character is a valid key-value splitter, but this implementation currently only writes with the '=' splitter
     sectionless-node: see here!

     # This is a section
     # These sections are the only way of splitting up configuration settings
     [section]
     key=value
     anotherkey = list, of, values


     [anothersection]
     # Because this value is surrounded by quotes, this is not a list
     # Both sections and keys can have comments. These comments are read and written from the configuration file
     keys = "not, a, list"

      • getNode

        Description copied from interface: ConfigurationNodeSource

      • splitNodePath

        public String[] splitNodePath(String path)
        Description copied from interface: Configuration
        Split the provided path into a string array suitable for accessing the correct configuration children. Normally this just splits the path with the Configuration.getPathSeparator(), but can limit how deep a child path can go or whether this configuration can even have children.
        Specified by:
        splitNodePath in interface Configuration
        Overrides:

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        The connectly split path.

      • ensureCorrectPath

        public String[] ensureCorrectPath(String[] rawPath)
        Description copied from interface: Configuration
        Make sure the provided path meets the requirements. A correct implementation of Configuration will impose the same restrictions on this and Configuration.splitNodePath(String), so invoking this method on an array from Configuration.splitNodePath(String) would return the original array.
        Specified by:
        ensureCorrectPath in interface Configuration
        Overrides:
